title: Congress must defund Planned Parenthood, Walker says
content:
Buy Photo  
Republican presidential candidate Scott Walker speaks during the Faith and Freedom Coalition Dinner at the Iowa State Fairgrounds in Des Moines on Saturday, September 19, 2015. (Photo: Brian Powers/The Register) Buy Photo 
 
Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker said shutting down the government is not necessary to defund Planned Parenthood, saying a House and Senate majority could achieve that instead. 
    
At the Iowa Faith and Freedom Coalition Dinner, Walker acknowledged the frustrations some Republicans feel about the inaction in Washington regarding abortion. Instead of shutting down the government, he said the House and Senate could get a majority vote of 51 and pass a spending bill that defunds Planned Parenthood.
